body_html:
also on the point about git blame, we can always just use git blame -w which will ignore whitespace only changes. So we can still get the desired information fairly easily

-w
           Ignore whitespace when comparing the parent's version and the child's to find where the lines came from.
body_text:
also on the point about git blame, we can always just use git blame -w which will ignore whitespace only changes. So we can still get the desired information fairly easily
-w
           Ignore whitespace when comparing the parent's version and the child's to find where the lines came from.
body:
also on the point about `git blame`, we can always just use `git blame -w` which will ignore whitespace only changes. So we can still get the desired information fairly easily

```
-w
           Ignore whitespace when comparing the parent's version and the child's to find where the lines came from.
```
